org.jruyi.common

Class CharKmp

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jruyi.common.CharKmp

  • public final class CharKmp
extends java.lang.Object
    A character sequence to be searched for using the Knuth-Morris-Pratt algorithm.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CharKmp(char[] pattern)
      Constructs a KMP pattern with the given pattern as the sequence to be searched for.
      CharKmp(char[] pattern, int offset, int length)
      Constructs a KMP pattern with the given pattern starting at offset ending at (offset + length) to be searched for.
      CharKmp(java.lang.String pattern)
      Constructs a KMP pattern with the given pattern as the sequence to be searched for.
      CharKmp(java.lang.String pattern, int offset, int length)
      Constructs a KMP pattern with the given pattern starting at offset ending at (offset + length) to be searched for.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int findIn(char[] target, int offset, int length)
      Returns the index of the first occurrence of this KMP sequence in the given sequence target starting at offset ending at (offset + length).
      int length()
      Returns the length of this sequence.
      int rfindIn(char[] target, int offset, int length)
      Returns the index of the rightmost occurrence of this KMP sequence in the given sequence target starting at offset ending at (offset + length).

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • findIn

        public int findIn(char[] target,
         int offset,
         int length)
        Returns the index of the first occurrence of this KMP sequence in the given sequence target starting at offset ending at (offset + length).
        Parameters:
        target - the sequence to be searched
        offset - the index to be searched from
        length - the number of characters to be searched
        Returns:
        the index of the first matched subsequence, or -1 if not found
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if offset or length doesn't hold the condition

      • rfindIn

        public int rfindIn(char[] target,
          int offset,
          int length)
        Returns the index of the rightmost occurrence of this KMP sequence in the given sequence target starting at offset ending at (offset + length).
        Parameters:
        target - the sequence to be searched
        offset - the index to be searched from
        length - the number of characters to be searched
        Returns:
        the index of the rightmost occurrence of this KMP, or -1 if not found
        Throws:
        java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException - if offset or length doesn't hold the condition

      • length

        public int length()
        Returns the length of this sequence.
        Returns:
        the length of this sequence
